title: An anti-Nat Unionist pact may be unholy but it's essential
text:
Almost every time the words "general election" are mentioned in the Commons these days the loudest cheers come from the SNP benches below the gangway.

Buoyed by opinion poll suggestions that say they’d win something in the order of 50 of Scotland’s 59 Westminster seats, the 35 nationalist MPs reckon that even that prediction is on the modest side and that a more likely scenario is a return to the 56 seats they captured in 2015.

As a result, the SNP MPs take great delight in jeering and waving "cheerio, cheerio" at the 13 Tory MPs – 12 of whom were only elected two years ago – who sit opposite them on the government benches. It is these Tory seats, most of which were wrested from the SNP in 2017,...
description: Almost every time the words "general election" are mentioned in the Commons these days the loudest cheers come from the SNP benches below the gangway.
